ONE OF THE MEN WANTS TO CALL HIS
HE'S DESPERATE TO TELL HER HE

WE DIAL HER NUMBER ON OUR
>> THEY ARE GONE, THEY ARE ALL

title: Haiyan survivor: My family is all gone

comments.text:
I am a German, living in the Philippines since 27 Years....this Country 
will never learn from past Disasters, because Philippinos forget to easily, 
will never learn from the Past and the Government is ALWAYS the same 
Bullshit! The Help from all over the World was incredible great, but still 
some phil. Reporter and Newscaster (like Corinna Sanchez) was blaming the 
Foreign-Aid and Foreign-Reporter!!!! Why not blaming their OWN 
Relief-Operations, which came very late.....AFTER  the Foreign-NGO's was 
already there in full-blown Operations!? WHAT will happen to the 
Philippines without the amazing Help from all over the World!?﻿

comments.author: Movies Magic

comments.text:
I survived haiyan..i and my family barely made it... but we struggled to 
survive days after haiyan... we lost relatives and friends..we lost our 
houses yet there was no food, no relief, no hope. We had to sit down and 
sleep on what's left of our couch..we ate beside dead bodies of people from 
our baranggay whom we knew all our life...we hafta struggled with the fear 
of darkness at night..there were snakes everywhere, people were walking on 
the streets with no definite place to go...there were looters..shoot 
outs... we didnt know who to trust or what to think of anymore.. 
it was by far the lowest part of my life...i stayed there for 7days..when 
luckily we had the chance to ride a bus for manila....﻿

comments.author: scott goodman

comments.text:
I've been watching the local news and what a contrast it is to CNN's 
coverage, in the local news celebrities are being featured, Angel Locsin 
and Kris Aquino handing out relief goods, the focus is not really on the 
people, or the "news". I can also say that our country's current 
administration is just show business. Even our former president who was 
impeached was a former action star and he still won as Manila's mayor 
because he did a movie about Tondo (a gangster area in Manila). I just wish 
the format of the media will change or we are destined to be 
celebrity-idolizing idiots for the rest of our lives. Filipinos should 
start taking our government seriously, look at how were suffering because 
of these incompetent people we elect.﻿
comments.author: mage.maggie

comments.text:
yeah....it just annoys me if some random celebrities/actor or actresses 
appears in this type of news. I mean seriously, is it really necessary to 
show off their faces in the TV and mentioning their names? The media should 
just shut their mouth off about celebrities helping those people, they 
should just focus to the victim's situations in Tacloban
comments.author: JRproduction101

comments.text:
It's been a week since the storm hit. I still can't believe it. We just 
went last April, this year to Tacloban for Sining Pambansa. It was just an 
amazing experience, and when I saw the news, I was completely devastated. I 
saw the Gaisano mall and it was not like that the last time I went there. 
It was a complete dissaster I realy hope Visayas can rise up again and 
start a new beggining. May their hopes and faiths be strong.﻿
